docs.title: Nepali Unicoder Documentation
docs.text: Welcome to the official documentation for Nepali Unicoder, a robust Python package for converting Romanized Nepali text and Preeti font text into Unicode Devanagari script.

docs.title: Overview
docs.text: Nepali Unicoder provides tools to handle the complexities of Devanagari script conversion, including contextual rules for Preeti font and a greedy matching algorithm for Roman transliteration.

docs.title: Documentation Sections
docs.text: -   :material-rocket-launch:{ .lg .middle } __[Getting Started](./usage.md)__      ---      Learn how to install and use the package via CLI and Python API.  -   :material-keyboard-variant:{ .lg .middle } __[Preeti Mappings](./preeti_mappings.md)__      ---      A comprehensive guide to Preeti character mappings and rules.  -   :material-api:{ .lg .middle } __[API Reference](./api_reference.md)__      ---      Technical details about the project's classes and methods.

docs.title: How it Works
docs.text:
graph TD
    A[Input Text] --> B{Mode?}
    B -- Roman --> C[Trie-based Greedy Match]
    B -- Preeti --> D[Dual-Phase Conversion]
    D --> E[Character Mapping]
    E --> F[Contextual Processing]
    C --> G[Unicode Output]
    F --> G
  • Greedy Phonetic Matching: Prioritizes longer matches for more accurate Roman-to-Unicode conversion.
  • Extensive Preeti Support: Over 40+ mappings and contextual rules (reph, matras, combined forms).
  • English Block Support: Use {} to preserve English text within converted strings.
  • Custom Overrides: Add custom word-level mappings via word_maps.json.

docs.title: API Reference
docs.text: This document provides technical details about the classes and methods available in the Nepali Unicoder package.

docs.title: Converter Class
docs.text: The Converter class is a simplified wrapper around the Engine for easy usage.

docs.title: __init__(self, mode: str = "roman")
docs.text: Initializes a new Converter. - mode: Either "roman" (default) or "preeti".

docs.title: convert(self, text: str) -> str
docs.text: Translates the input text to Unicode Devanagari. - text: The input string (Romanized Nepali or Preeti characters).

docs.title: Engine Class
docs.text: The core conversion logic is implemented in the Engine class.

docs.title: __init__(self, trie: Optional[Trie] = None, tokenizer: Optional[Tokenizer] = None, mode: str = "roman")
docs.text: Initializes the conversion engine. - Loads the appropriate character mappings into a Trie based on the mode. - Loads post_rules for contextual transformations in Preeti mode.

docs.title: Tokenizer Class
docs.text: The Tokenizer splits the input text into meaningful chunks (Tokens).

docs.title: tokenize(self, text: str, use_blocks: bool = True) -> List[Token]
docs.text: Splits text into tokens based on types: ROMAN, BLOCK, LITERAL, and NUMBER. - use_blocks: If True (default), recognizes {...} as "as-is" blocks. In Preeti mode, this is typically set to False by the Engine.

docs.title: Contextual Rules
docs.text:
The conversion engine applies several post-processing rules to handle the complexities of Devanagari script.

Rule: Reph Positioning

The character { (ර්) is moved before the preceding consonant cluster.

  • s{ → र्क
Rule: Matra Reordering

The short-i matra (l / ि) is moved after the consonant cluster it modifies.

  • sl → कि
Rule: M-Transformations

Special transformations for the m character:

  • त्रm → क्र
  • त्तm → क्त
  • उm → ऊ
  • भm → झ
  • पm → फ
Rule: Vowel Combinations
  • अ + ा + े → ओ
  • अ + ा + ै → औ
  • अ + ा → आ

docs.title: Usage Guide
docs.text: This guide describes how to use Nepali Unicoder through its Command Line Interface (CLI) and Python API.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: pip install nepali-unicoder

docs.title: Python API
docs.text: The primary interface is the Converter class.

docs.title: Roman to Unicode Mode (Default)
docs.text:
from nepali_unicoder.convert import Converter

# Initialize converter
converter = Converter()

# Convert phonetic Roman text
print(converter.convert("namaste")) 
# Output: नमस्ते

docs.title: Preeti to Unicode Mode
docs.text:
# Initialize converter in Preeti mode
preeti_converter = Converter(mode="preeti")

# Convert Preeti characters
print(preeti_converter.convert("s{sf"))
# Output: र्कर्का

docs.title: Handling Mixed English Content
docs.text:
You can wrap English words or any text you want to preserve in curly braces {}.

text = "mero {name} sanjeev ho."
print(converter.convert(text))
# Output: मेरो name सन्जीव् हो।

English Preservation

In Preeti mode, the curly braces { and } are treated as normal characters because they are part of the Preeti font mapping.

docs.title: Command Line Interface
docs.text: You can run the package directly from your shell.

docs.title: Basic Usage
docs.text:
python -m nepali_unicoder "nepaala"
# Output: नेपाल

docs.title: Preeti Conversion
docs.text:
Use the --preeti flag for Preeti font text.

python -m nepali_unicoder --preeti "s{sf"
# Output: र्कर्का

docs.title: Piping Input
docs.text:
echo "mero naam sanjeev ho" | python -m nepali_unicoder
# Output: मेरो नाम सन्जीव् हो
